alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 10:47AM CDT until May 13 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Hempstead, Howard and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms is tapering off quickly. However, previous heavy rains this morning may still cause urban and small stream flooding for a few more hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nashville, Mineral Springs, Tollette, Corinth, Saratoga, McCaskill, Ozan and Bright Star. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
